description:
At Google, data drives all of our decision-making. As part of the Finance Business Intelligence team, you will use data to inform business and product decisions across the company. Using your technical skills, business acumen and creativity, you will build tools to automate reporting and generate insight that will allow clients to quickly and accurately see how our key business products and processes are performing. Previous experience managing finance systems projects, with emphasis on providing business intelligence and data driven insight through reporting, will have equipped you well for this role. You’ll be involved in projects from inception to delivery, ensuring that your reporting delivers high-quality and relevant data to intelligently grow our business. You will also have extensive knowledge of key financial systems, such as Oracle and Hyperion, and experience working with a range of other business intelligence tools and platforms.

As a Business Intelligence Analyst, you'll support the Hardware Finance team with data management and complex queries to drive business insights and economic analyses.

You'll work with Engineering to create datasets and dashboards that will be used internally to ensure accuracy and timeliness of Hardware sales recognition and cost of sales reporting.

You'll work across multiple systems to help the Hardware Business Finance team work more efficiently and effectively, help the business solve problems and make timely business decisions.

The name Google came from "googol," a mathematical term for the number 1 followed by 100 zeros. And nobody at Google loves big numbers like the Finance team when providing in depth analysis on all manner of strategic decisions across Google products. From developing forward-thinking analysis to generating management reports to scaling our automated financial processes, the Finance organization is an important partner and advisor to the business.

qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Information Systems, Accounting, or a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of relevant work experience.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Statistics.
  • Experience developing management reporting, KPIs, and business metrics, and working across different functions within a company.
  • Understanding of US GAAP or experience with cost of sales processes/recognition.
  • Knowledge of SQL, Java, and/or Python, core sales and cost processes (e.g., accounting, billing, collections, payables) and standard finance systems.
  • Familiarity with enterprise data analysis and common management reporting platforms.
  • Demonstrated technical skills, including proficiency in SQL, data analysis, and dashboard reporting. Success working in a cross-functional, fast-paced environment and managing complex initiatives.
responsibilities:
• Develop expertise to become a Subject Matter Expert (SME) for datasets relevant to the Hardware Business Finance team. Leverage data to assess the effectiveness of current controls, determine future improvements, and own inventory of datasets.
  • Develop queries/dashboards based on requirements provided by the Finance/Accounting team and engage with Hardware Financial Planning and Analysis and Engineering teams, as needed based on complexity.
  • Develop processes to assist the Hardware Business Finance team in researching financial data discrepancies/fluctuations.
  • Partner with Platforms team to create business cases and business requirements documents, provide UAT plans and drive testing requirements in line with business and finance requirements.
  • Partner closely with the Controllership team to understand accounting requirements for new system solutions including profits and loss, granularity, units data, etc.
title: Business Intelligence Analyst, Hardware Finance
